headline: Banana Zucchini Bread
description: This banana zucchini bread with cinnamon, walnuts, and cranberries combines everyone's favorite flavors in a moist and delicious breakfast treat.
name: Banana Zucchini Bread

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Grease and flour two 8x4-inch bread loaf pans.

Beat eggs in a large bowl with an electric mixer until light yellow and frothy. Add white sugar, zucchini, oil, bananas, brown sugar, and vanilla; beat until well combined. Stir in flour, cinnamon, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. Fold in cranberries and nuts. Divide batter evenly between the prepared loaf pans.
Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, 45 to 50 minutes. Allow to cool in the loaf pans on a wire rack before removing and serving.

review.reviewBody: This become a standard in our house! Everyone enjoys the combination of savory and sweet.
Was perfect
really good! I added 1 extra banana, an extra cut zucchini, and 1 tsp. cloves. I also decreased white sugar to 3/4 like everyone else.
Excellent recipe. Ran out of vanilla extract so used cognac instead.
Yes, i did 2cups of zucchini and 3 bananas. followed the rest of the recipe as instructed. It came out moist and tasted great, we all loved it. Great recipe!
Very good and very easy to make

I was disappointed with this recipe. It was terribly dry. It is more enjoyable with a cup of coffee to help with the dryness. The only things I changed were to use no nuts and I cut the white sugar by about 1/3c. I wish I had read the comments section first.

Made it per recipe. A great bread that was moist, with both zucchini and banana flavor. I halved the cranberries and nuts and only put in one of the two loaves to satisfying my picky eaters. Both were great! Will make again.

While this wasn't bad, it was a bit dry. And, ultimately, the flavor wasn't as good as either banana bread or zucchini bread. So, I'll probably stick with making separate recipes to use up those extra bananas and zucchini.
Came out perfectly! I didn’t have any cranberries but I’ll be sure to use them next time. Delicious!!

things i did different then the recipe. used a 1/2 cup of white sugar and brown sugar, used 1 cup of mashed bananas, 2 cups of whole wheat flour and 1 1/2 cup of white flour, 1/4 teaspoon of salt, no cranberries, 1 cup of nuts. all the other ingredients the same

Good recipe, but you HAVE to add more moisture, it's too dry. first time, I used twice the bananas, and extra zucchini... it was AWESOME. Second time, followed the recipe only because I didn't have extra bananas and zucchini, and it was too dry.

I subbed 1/2 C of Stevia for the 1 C of white sugar, and instead of oil I subbed plain white yogurt. I used 3 bananas and 3/4 of a zucchini, and finally, I also added some cardamom. Turned out great! It didn't seem any less sweet and it was very moist.
I have to admit I also ground up quick cooking oats and made oat flour - the texture was less refined, but really good.

Delicious! I made this with my son so of course he wanted to add chocolate chips instead of the craisins. So we did! I added 1 cup of chocolate chips. Very easy, quick and delicious bread to make. Ours took longer to bake than what was written. Will definitely make this again.
Cooked it for 65 minutes and it turned out great
I made it and making it again. I have a lot of friends who want it . I put into the recipe 2 1/2 bananas in it instead of the 2. It is a very good bread and very easy to make.
It was great! I added 1 cup chocolate chips and a TBSP orange zest...skipped the nuts! Light and moist!
Very good! Like the idea of adding more zucchini & using apple sauce vs. oil next time.

Great! You can actually taste banana and zucchini in the bread. After reading some of the comments, I did add an extra banana to lower the white sugar to only 1/2 cup. I also just grated two zucchinis and did not measure because I have another recipe for just zucchini bread and it takes 2 cups. I may have also added chocolate chips instead of cranberries because why not

Followed the advice in the comments 1/2 the sugar and double the zucchini. I also used coconut oil instead of vegetable oil. I did not use the cranberries. I made one loaf and used my pampered chef individual brownie pan for the other. The minis only took about 25-30 min and Were perfect.

For some reason this bread seems healthier than plain banana bread!! The zucchini adds moisture to the batter, which results in a nice textured loaf. Added bonus: The kids don't realize there is a veggie in their banana bread.
I added 2 cups of zuchinni versus the one, as suggested in the reviews, 3/4 cup of honey in place of the white sugar, and half whole wheat/half white flour. It is sweet, moist, and oh so yummy.

While these changes do not completely make this keto friendly, they do cut down on the carbs. I substituted Truvia brown sugar, and Truvia white sugar. I reduced the white sugar to 1/2 cup. I also replaced the full amount of flour by substituting one cup of regular flour and one and a half cups of almond flour. I left out the cranberries. Kept everything else the same. It was delicious!??

I haven’t tasted it yet, but I substituted half a cup of brown rice flour because I have it, I also added 2 cups of shredded zucchini, sprinkle chocolate chips on top and used canola and olive oil instead of vegetable oil. We will see how this turns out, but it smells delicious.?
amazing!

This bread is delicious very moist I will definitely make it again didn't have the Cranberries but still turned out very good and I also think that maybe dried cherries would be delicious I highly recommend this recipe.
It looks and tastes amazing. I just put less sugar.
Real easy, inexpensive. Even if you pull a "Dad error," and use cucumber instead of zucchini.
was a little dry, may add a little more liquid nest time
I made this exactly as written as I do whenever I try a new recipe and it was exceptional. I look forward to making it again!
Love the banana zucchini combo.

A serious case of YUM!!! All the right touches of flavour and a perfect texture. One loaf didn't last the day. The other seems to be melting before our eyes... Thank you, Heather, for a lovely recipe.
A bit dry. Like others better

Very good!
I made some modifications:
I used coconut oil instead of vegetable oil (for health, plus added great flavor).
I used 3 bananas and 2 cups zucchini.
As per recommendations, cut back white sugar to 1/2 cup.
I subbed in 1 cup of whole wheat flour.
Added 1 cup of chocolate chips.

I made this recipe twice, the second time I made with almond flour and as muffins, love love it. 
Both time I made vegan. 
Just take the eggs out and the banana works as egg replacements.
Daughter loves it, probably should have cooked a little longer. Also a great treat to share with my pup as i left out the nuts and cranberries.
Over cooked it a little but flavor was great
I deleted the cranberries and added a cup of applesauce for more moisture loaves.
I have an over-abundance of zucchini this year and looking for some new recipes to use the zucchini in. This recipe is so flavorful and tasty. This is definitely a keeper!!!

If I made this as written, I'd give it 4 stars but since I'm trying to make healthy snacks for my kids I tweaked it as follows:
used 2.5 cups oat flour, 1/2 cup white sugar, 1/2 cup applesauce instead of oil plus 1/4 cup oil, only had 1 zucchini, 4 bananas (overripe), 1.25 cups walnuts, 1/4 cup cranberries
- made a loaf and 20 cupcakes
- cupcakes baked at 140°C for 20 mins and loaf for 65 mins. Cupcakes needed a few more mins to bake but turned out great! 
-next time try adding 3 bananas and 2 zucchinis
Awesome banana bread

Still in the oven, but recipe very easy to follow! I did add an extra banana as well as a bit more zucchini as well as decreased the white sugar - 1 C. simply too much! Can't wait to try it as my house smells sweetly with this baking in the oven!

I adjusted the amount of bananas and zucchini as I had more the two bananas. Also added one little box of raisins, plain yogurt, and sour cream. I sprinkled light brown sugar at bottom of (bundt) pan. Turned out very moist and delicious.

Yummers! 
I needed a recipe for Banana Zucchini Bread as the
store-bought banana bread always has way too much sugar.
I halved the posted recipe and made the following changes:
3 ripe bananas,
1 whole grated zucchini,
1 ounce of white sugar but still used 1/3 cup brown sugar and
omitted the cranberries as I didn't have any on hand.
It was still a little raw after 50 minutes so I put it back in for an additional 10 minutes.
So delicious!

I am really happy with the way this bread turned out! Its texture and flavor are perfect! However, I did make the following changes:
1) I substituted 1/2 cup orange blossom honey for the cup of white sugar
2) 1/4 cup grapeseed oil and 1/4 ciphered Lighter Bake in place of 1cup oil 
3) used 4 eggs
4)I used 4 ripe bananas and 31/2 cups shredded zucchini and 2 cups frozen cranberries 
5) 2 tsps Vanilla extract ,1tsp coconut extract/ 1 tsp lemon extract
6) 2tsp cinnamon 1tsp pumkin pie spice

I used only white sugar as I didn't have the brown one, so probably no more than 1 1/2 cups of sugar, I found the mixture a little bit dry so I added a little container of unsweetened apple sauce. I used 2 cup of all purpose fluor and the rest was garbanzo-fava flour so it gets more protein. I grated a full zuchini which was almost 2 cups and probably more banana. It turned great !! ... and less calories
First time making zucchini bread and it was delicious! I grated a persimmon in as well. I didn’t have craisins
First time making zucchini bread and it was delicious! I grated a persimmon in as well. I didn’t have craisins
This recipe is really good. I added flax seed (grounded) and chia seed (grounded) and shredded coconut. I will for sure make this again.
It is not the best I have made but it's good. I added chocolate chips as well.

Very good. I also decreased the white sugar to 1/2 cup and increased the zucchini to 2 cups as others suggested, and now it is not at all overly sweet. It is very good and easy to put together. I'll definitely make it again.
This turned out amazing! I did modify it, 1/2 C white sugar, 2 cups of zucchini as others mentioned. I also used 1/2 cup of granola in place of the nuts due to a nut allergy and it turned out great!

I loved the combination of flavors in this bread! I would have given it 5 stars except that I think it needs to be reworked a little. I had some trouble with the bake time, as stated in several other reviews. I made one loaf and 6 large muffins. The muffins were perfect but the loaf still had raw spots even with 20 extra minutes (I had to foil top to keep bread from burning).

This was a great recipe. I added an additional banana and an additional cup of zucchini which I partially squeezed the water out of. I used 1 cup coconut flour, one cup rolled oats, an 1 1/2 cups all purpose flour. I didn't have walnuts so I used pecans in their place. I did not use the white sugar and I substituted applesauce for the oil. This made 27 muffins that I baked 22 minutes on the first batch and 25 for the next batch. Even though the toothpick came out clean on the first batch, they needed to cook a little longer. Taste is flavorful and healthy. Look forward to making again!
Delicious and easy. I even substituted canned pumpkin for the oil and it turned out great.
I omitted the cranberry but very good receipe

Great recipe but I did make alterations for my families dietary needs. Used 2 1/2 C gluten free flour +1C oat flour, 3 mashed bananas and 2 C shredded zucchini as others suggested. Decreased oil slightly to 2/3 C. Added frozen blueberries. Not sure how much due to baking in large muffin pans and just submersing 7-8 berries on top of batter. Baked perfectly at 20 min. Very yummy!
Awesome banana/zuccini bread, I added 2 cups zucchini and one extra banana and 1/2 cup chocolate chips instead of cranberries
I did up the temp to 340 since I use white whole wheat flour and have found it need a slightly higher temperature. Came out golden and delicious.
This is a fantastic bread recipe. I used blueberries instead of the cranberries but followed the rest of the recipe exactly. I saved it because it's my new favorite quick bread recipe!

I modified this by using 2 cups of shredded zucchini and 3 small bananas. I baked for 40 minutes an fused Texas size muffin pan. a little on the dry side. I think I need to add more oil with this modification. Otherwise this has good flavor!
I followed the recipe exactly. It was not done in 50 minutes so I cooked it for five more minutes. It was done then but a tad dry. Nice flavor.
I made this bread exactly as the recipe stated. The flavor is good, but it is a little dry. Any suggestions for making it moister? I didn’t drain the shredded zucchini.
I did not use the Cranberries but it turned out really amazing without them. Will try using them in the future.

The only changes I made was I only used 1/2 c of white sugar, used 4 mashed bananas, 1 cup of blueberries and 1 c up of chopped walnuts. Turned out so good. I made them in cupcake pans. Definitely will make again
Added one banana and substituted 1/2 cup applesauce. Used less sugar

This is a good recipe but I had a lot of zucchini to use! I used 2 cups of zucchini, added 1/3 cup unsweetened cocoa, used 3 bananas and took out the cranberries. I baked for 60 minutes and it came out tasty and beautiful! I made 8 loaves today, the neighbors are thrilled!
I don't care for nuts, so I didn't add them. My whole family LOVED this. Not too sweet, just right!

Great recipe! I did make some changes though: used chia seed as egg substitute, coconut oil instead of vegetable oil, and I didn't have cranberries so I used raisins. It turned out soft, fluffy, and moist.
Added extra 1/2 cup zucchini and omitted the cranberries. Substituted splenda for the white sugar. Freezes well. This recipe is a keeper!!

This bread is a favorite in our home. My sons love it. Especially the one who hates veggies. I actually use 4 bananas and a whole zucchini to make it a little tastier and moist. I puree the zucchini and bananas in a food processor.
I made this bread to incorporate a little fiber into my grands diet and it was a hit! They really liked it. I will be making it again, soon.
Great recipe, very tasty though next time I want to add more cranberries.
Excellent
Tasted great. Made a few changes. I used 1/2 cup of Greek yogurt and 1/4 of coconut oil instead of the vegetable oil. I added 1/2 cup of blueberries and only used 1 banana. Came out delicious.
I would make it again. Moist bread.

Great recipe, I realized I didn't have enough all-purpose flour after I started, so I used 1 cup white, 2 cups whole wheat and a 1/2 cup of almond flour. It came out with a great texture and incredibly delicious. Can't wait to freeze a loaf and have an excuse to eat this again.

I kept the ingredients almost the same, minus cranberries or nuts as I didn't have any on hand. I dramatically changed the directions and believe it made a big improvement over some of the concerns expressed in other reviews. 

1. I used one very ripe banana previously frozen and one fresh banana, sliced about 1/2", then quartered. Combined that with a heavily packed one cup grated zucchini, and 1/4 cup of homemade Madagascar vanilla rum. Set aside. 

2. Separated eggs and whipped the whites with some cream of tartar to stiff peaks, and set aside. 

3. Added all dry ingredients into a bowl, whisked together, and set aside. 

4. For oil I used butter and creamed this first with the white sugar, then added the brown sugar until frothy. Added in egg yolks and whipped until fully combined. I then gradually added the dry ingredients until the mixture became a crumble (mind you I am using the whisk attachment and kitchen aide mixer) 

5. Gently fold egg whites into zucchini/banana/rum mix, then gently folded in crumble 1/3 at a time. 

It came out very light and moist, but held together perfectly for serving. The flavors were delicate, but present. 

If I were to do it again, I would add some nutmeg and allspice, sprayed the top with simple sugar, and cooked it for 1:15 @ 300F°. 

I will absolutely use what is here as a guide again.

Nice recipe. I reduced the white sugar to 2/3 cup and doubled the shredded zucchini; it still turned out really sweet. Next time I will try 1/2 cup each brown and white sugars. I also substituted 1 c. whole wheat flour for all-purpose flour and used a snack size cup of applesauce to replace some of the oil. I baked 12 muffins and one 8x8 pan (to expedite the cooking time). Overall, I enjoyed the end result!

The only thing I did different was add 3 bananas instead of 2 and i had to let it cook an additional 20 minutes because i used one loaf pan, delicious! Let my fiancé and Co workers taste it before me and they loved it. Already asking when the next loaf is coming. Will definitely make this again really soon.

I have made this many times. The first time was exact to the recipe given. I felt it needed more so I read the reviews and I have come to these conclusions. Add 1 or even 2 more bananas. Increase the amount of zucchini by a half cup. I also have doubled the amount of raisins and nuts. This bread is so easy you really can't go wrong but these changes are what makes it over the top good. You will be suprised at how forgiving the recipe is. Just make it to your taste!

I made this bread this morning. I did make some changes tho. I cut the sugar in half (1/2 cup white , 1/3 cup brown sugar) I also made it gluten free by using Krusteaz Gluten free flour blend. (I used 2 2/3 Cups) and added 1 tsp. xanthan gum. I didn't add the cranberries either because I didn't have any. It was delicious!! very moist and flavorful!

I should have read the reviews first, but I also added more zucchini, less sugar, and subbed applesauce for some of the oil. I think it turned out great, except it felt like there was a ton of flour. It ended up being somewhat dry. I'd probably cut back on this next time.
We Loved this recipe; the only change I made was 1/2 cup of brown sugar and 1/2 cup of white sugar. I would definitely use this wonderful recipe again. Thanks for sharing it!
I made this bread directly from the recipe, made no changes and it turned out great. The recipe was simple enough to follow and made it easy for my 6yo to assist.

Will definitely make again! Only change will be to increase quantity of fruit and nuts from 1/2 cup each to 1 cup each. Texture of this bread is incredible! Sooooo good as is, but also a real treat to toast! Oh, the aroma! I think I need to go have some more right now just talking about it! :)

I thought the flavor combo of this was great. I did add about an extra ¾ c of zucchini, only because I didn’t want to save it. I think the sugar amount is perfect. I sprinkled some chopped pecans on top so people would know there were nuts in it. Mine took at least 60 minutes to bake. I’ll probably try this again some time.

Like this recipe as it includes a wonderful selection of fruit and vegetables, which makes it so nice and moist. I changed it a bit, adding some ground nutmeg, ground cloves and ground ginger as well as and cocoa. K

I made this into muffins and baked about 15 to 20 minutes. It made 24 muffins. This is soooo good, I will be making them year round! ( I did add an extra 1/2 banana because I had it. I will do that again)
Next time I will add more bit more bananas, I used 2 and no flavor. I add applesauce instead of oil and I add some nutmeg too. Dense and rich bread

Just an "ok" recipe. I think the amount of banana needs increased for sure, a lot of banana breads have as many as 6 so 2 doesn't lend nearly as much moisture, and you end up with a much airy and drier than typical banana bread. Also, three cups of flour is enough. I only used 1 cup of sugar in this, but the sweetness was still ok for me. It was not bad toasted with some homemade jam, so we ate it anyway! But wouldn't make it again.
Turned out very yummy! I used a little less sugar and more zucchini. I didn't have any nuts or cranberries so I added some chocolate chips!

I thought that this was a great recipe and I will definitely make it again. although I did add a handful more of zucchini and it still tastes more like banana bread. In stead of adding all the oil I did half oil and half apple sauce. And I will definitely make it again.

Very delicious way to use up zucchini and banana (used more of both of these than the recipe called for). Would definitely make this again over another similar recipe I tried on this website for the same.
Delicious!! I added an extra banana and 2 cups of zucchini because I like more, but I am sure it is great as written as well. Great reviews from the whole family. I will be making it again.

Added 1 cup cinnamon chips to the batter + 1/2 cup plain applesauce & decreased the oil down to 1/4 cup. It was a delightful surprise how delicious this bread tastes. I never considered zucchini & bananas together in a bread. Plus the cinnamon chips, & dried cranberries combined for a unique taste. Fantastic! ! This will be,a new family fave. Yum! I'll have another slice,please.??
Only change to the recipe was I added an extra banana. Family loved it!
This was delicious. I have tons of zucchini from my garden and I"m still trying to find recipes to put them to use and this was the best one yet. My family lioed it and I did too.
